thread.title: Kentucky, UNC Share No. 1 In Preseason Poll
thread.title_full: Kentucky, UNC Share No. 1 In Preseason Poll

title: Kentucky, UNC Share No. 1 In Preseason Poll
text:
Kentucky, UNC Share No. 1 In Preseason Poll Kentucky and UNC finished in a dead heat atop the coaches poll. Post to Facebook Kentucky, UNC Share No. 1 In Preseason Poll Kentucky and UNC finished in a dead heat atop the coaches poll.  //on.wfmy.com/1LwmIZa   Join the Conversation To   Kentucky, UNC Share No. 1 In Preseason Poll Eddie Timanus, USA TODAY Sports 5:51 p.m. EDT October 15, 2015 North Carolina Tar Heels players including guard Marcus Paige (5) and guard/forward Theo Pinson (1) and guard Nate Britt (0) react in the first half during the semifinals of the ACC Tournament at Greensboro Coliseum. (Photo: Bob Donnan-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
For a third consecutive year, the Kentucky men’s basketball team enters the season with a No. 1 before its name. But this time, the Wildcats have company. 
Kentucky and North Carolina finished in a dead heat atop the coaches poll, a first in the preseason since USA TODAY began administering the poll in 1991. The Tar Heels have one more first-place vote — 12 to the Wildcats' 11 — but both teams wound up with a total of 749 poll points. It’s the first time since 2011 and fourth time overall that the Tar Heels are rated No. 1 by the coaches in the preseason poll. 
Check out the full Top 25 list here: Men's Basketball Coaches Poll 
If the balloting is any indication of the action to come on the court, this figures to be one of the most wide-open campaigns for the ultimate prize in some time. 
Five teams received at least one No. 1 vote, the most in a preseason poll since the 2004-05 season when there were eight. Maryland claimed five firsts and checks in at No. 3. Defending NCAA champion Duke will open at No. 4, picking up three No. 1’s. Rounding out the top five and claiming the remaining first-place nod is Kansas. 
In addition to the Tar Heels and Blue Devils, Virginia checks in at No. 6 to give the Atlantic Coast Conference three representatives in the top 10. The Big 12 also had three with No. 7 Iowa State and No. 8 Oklahoma joining the Jayhawks. 
Overall the Big 12 has five clubs in the top 25, sharing the lead with the Big Ten. The ACC has four altogether, and the Pac-12 and SEC have three each. The Big East has a pair, with single ranked squads from the West Coast (No. 11 Gonzaga), the Missouri Valley (No. 12 Wichita State) and American (co-No. 24 Connecticut).
